verses.kjv: And you hath he quickened, who were dead in trespasses and sins;
verses.ct: You were once dead because of your sins and failures,

verses.kjv: Wherein in time past ye walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit that now worketh in the children of disobedience:
verses.ct: which used to define how you lived. You followed the ways of this world and obeyed the ruler of the power of the air — the spirit that is currently at work in those who refuse to obey God.

verses.kjv: Among whom also we all had our conversation in times past in the lusts of our flesh, fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the mind; and were by nature the children of wrath, even as others.
verses.ct: All of us used to live that same way, giving in to the cravings of our sinful nature and carrying out whatever our bodies and minds desired. In our natural state, we deserved God's anger just like everyone else.

verses.kjv: But God, who is rich in mercy, for his great love wherewith he loved us,
verses.ct: But God is overflowing with mercy, and because of the immense love he has for us,

verses.kjv: Even when we were dead in sins, hath quickened us together with Christ, (by grace ye are saved;)
verses.ct: even while we were dead in our sins, he made us alive together with Christ. It is by grace that you have been saved.

verses.kjv: And hath raised us up together, and made us sit together in heavenly places in Christ Jesus:
verses.ct: He raised us up with Christ and seated us with him in the heavenly realm through our union with Christ Jesus,

verses.kjv: That in the ages to come he might shew the exceeding riches of his grace in his kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: so that throughout all future ages he could display the incredible richness of his grace through his kindness to us in Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:
verses.ct: For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith — and this didn't come from you. It is God's gift.

verses.kjv: Not of works, lest any man should boast.
verses.ct: It is not based on anything you've done, so no one can take credit for it.

verses.kjv: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus unto good works, which God hath before ordained that we should walk in them.
verses.ct: We are God's masterpiece, created in Christ Jesus to do good works that God prepared in advance for us to carry out.

verses.kjv: Wherefore remember, that ye being in time past Gentiles in the flesh, who are called Uncircumcision by that which is called the Circumcision in the flesh made by hands;
verses.ct: So remember this: you were once Gentiles by birth — called "the uncircumcised" by those who call themselves "the circumcised" because of a procedure done to their bodies by human hands.

verses.kjv: That at that time ye were without Christ, being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers from the covenants of promise, having no hope, and without God in the world:
verses.ct: At that time you were separated from Christ, excluded from citizenship among Israel's people, and outsiders to the covenants of promise. You had no hope and lived without God in the world.

verses.kjv: But now in Christ Jesus ye who sometimes were far off are made nigh by the blood of Christ.
verses.ct: But now, through your union with Christ Jesus, you who were once far away have been brought near through the blood of Christ.

verses.kjv: For he is our peace, who hath made both one, and hath broken down the middle wall of partition between us;
verses.ct: Christ himself is our peace. He has united the two groups into one and has torn down the dividing wall of hostility that separated them.

verses.kjv: Having abolished in his flesh the enmity, even the law of commandments contained in ordinances; for to make in himself of twain one new man, so making peace;
verses.ct: Through his own body, he put an end to the hostility by setting aside the law with its commandments and regulations. His purpose was to take the two groups and create in himself one new humanity, establishing peace.

verses.kjv: And that he might reconcile both unto God in one body by the cross, having slain the enmity thereby:
verses.ct: He did this to reconcile both groups to God in one body through the cross, destroying the hostility through it.

verses.kjv: And came and preached peace to you which were afar off, and to them that were nigh.
verses.ct: He came and proclaimed peace to you who were far away and peace to those who were near.

verses.kjv: For through him we both have access by one Spirit unto the Father.
verses.ct: Because through him, both groups have access to the Father by one Spirit.

verses.kjv: Now therefore ye are no more strangers and foreigners, but fellowcitizens with the saints, and of the household of God;
verses.ct: So you are no longer outsiders or foreigners. Instead, you are fellow citizens with God's people and members of God's household.

verses.kjv: And are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ himself being the chief corner stone;
verses.ct: You are built on the foundation laid by the apostles and prophets, with Christ Jesus himself as the cornerstone.

verses.kjv: In whom all the building fitly framed together groweth unto an holy temple in the Lord:
verses.ct: In him, the entire structure is joined together and grows into a holy temple in the Lord.

verses.kjv: In whom ye also are builded together for an habitation of God through the Spirit.
verses.ct: In him, you too are being constructed together into a place where God lives through the Spirit.
